p: The largest proportion of Bison specimens were associated with two large fluctuations from 15,000 years ago to present that included warming in the Bølling–Allerød period (15,000 years to 13,000 years ago), cooling in the Younger Dryas (13,000 to 12,000 years ago), and warming through the Holocene period to present with small undulations in temperature, such as the Medieval Climatic Anomaly (approximately 1,000 to 700 years ago) and Little Ice Age (approximately 700 to 150 years ago; Figure 5).
